skill.name: codebase-analysis
skill.description: Techniques for analyzing existing codebases to reverse-engineer requirements and understand business logic. Use when conducting brownfield analysis or understanding existing system capabilities.
skill.summary: Techniques for analyzing existing codebases to reverse-engineer requirements and understand business...
skill.author: DoubleslashSE

security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based documentation skill with no executable code, network access, or file system modifications. Only uses read-only analysis tools (Read, Grep, Glob, LSP) to provide code analysis guidance.

content.user_title: Analyze codebases to extract business logic
content.value_statement: Legacy codebases contain valuable business knowledge that is often undocumented. This skill provides systematic techniques to reverse-engineer requirements, domain models, and technical specifications from existing code.
actual_capabilities: Map project structure and identify main components
Extract domain entities and their relationships
Identify validation rules and business logic patterns
Document API endpoints and integration points
Recognize architectural patterns like layered, CQRS, and event-driven
limitations: Analysis scope depends on AI assistant tool access permissions
Requires user-provided access to the target codebase
Cannot execute or modify code directly

use_cases.title: Document legacy systems
use_cases.description: Extract documentation from inherited codebases to understand system behavior and capabilities.

use_cases.title: Capture requirements
use_cases.description: Reverse-engineer business rules and requirements from existing code for system migrations.

use_cases.title: Assess integration points
use_cases.description: Map external system integrations and data flows for modernization planning.

prompt_templates.title: Map project structure
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze this codebase structure. Identify main directories, entry points, and how components are organized. List the key files and folders.

prompt_templates.title: Find domain entities
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all entity/model definitions in this codebase. List each entity with its attributes, data types, and relationships to other entities.

prompt_templates.title: Document business rules
prompt_templates.prompt: Identify and document all business rules, validation logic, and calculations in this codebase. Include file locations and method names.

prompt_templates.title: Map integrations
prompt_templates.prompt: Find all external integrations including API calls, database connections, and service dependencies. Document the data flow for each.

output_examples.input: Analyze this legacy order processing system and tell me what business rules exist
output: - Order must have at least one item
- Customer must have valid payment method on file
- Order total must equal sum of item totals

best_practices: Start analysis from entry points and follow the data flow through the system
Cross-reference code with any existing documentation or tests
Document findings as you go to build a complete system view
anti_patterns: Skipping architectural overview and jumping into individual files
Assuming code behavior without verifying through tests or execution
Missing validation rules that are implemented but not documented

faq.question: Which AI tools support this skill?
faq.answer: This skill works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Each tool provides different code access capabilities.

faq.question: How large of a codebase can it analyze?
faq.answer: Analysis scope depends on the AI assistant tool access. Very large codebases may require focusing on specific modules first.

faq.question: Does it integrate with documentation tools?
faq.answer: The skill produces markdown documentation that can be exported to any documentation platform manually.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: This skill only uses read-only analysis tools. Code remains on your machine and is not transmitted anywhere.

faq.question: Why are my search results empty?
faq.answer: Ensure the AI assistant has access to the codebase. Check that file patterns match your codebase language and structure.

faq.question: How is this different from grep?
faq.answer: This skill provides structured analysis techniques, heuristics for pattern recognition, and guidance for connecting findings into a complete system model.
